item.title: Tim Verstynen
item.description: @schoppik @elduvelle Even if the real story is murky, the narrative I have always heard around this photo always portrays it as a spontaneous ‚Äúgrabbed someone and started kissing‚Äù, which promotes the same toxic value. But I am willing to be wrong on the nuance of the back story.

item.title: Mr. Woman
item.description: in jesus's time saints would pick a few kind of mid things to be the patron of, mostly because they didn't want to show off or felt shy. this resulted in a lot of guys being the patron saint of stuff like debtors, coroners and nosebleeds. this is pretty feeble but it does leave a lot of the cooler stuff unclaimed, allowing people nowadays to become the patron saint of stuff like lions, punching and ketamine

item.title: deilann
item.description: My moral framework denies the existence of trolley problems and is more concerned with figuring out who is putting people on the tracks.

item.title: Nicole Rust
item.description:
Provocative
As a young psychologist, this chills me to my bones. Apparently is possible to reach the stratosphere of scientific achievement, to publish over and over again in ‚Äúhigh impact‚Äù journals, to rack up tens of thousands of citations, and for none of it to matter. Every marker of success, the things that are supposed to tell you that you're on the right track, that you're making a real contribution to science‚Äîthey might mean nothing.
(I agree: time to rethink the idea that any individual is how this works).I‚Äôm so sorry for psychology‚Äôs loss, whatever it ishttps://www.experimental-history.com/p/im-so-sorry-for-psychologys-loss

item.title: Mindy Weisberger (she/her)
item.description: Three little words you love to hear during a livestream of a RV dive to the seafloor: "It's a dumbo!" E/V Nautilus researchers spotted three dumbo octopuses (named for their big fins, which resemble Dumbo ears) during a recent dive near Johnston Atoll. There was a big one, a sassy one, and one with "beautiful flap-flaps." Truly, the best thing about these videos is hearing the scientists squee with joy about what they see. ü¶ëhttps://www.youtube.com/watch?v=vgF5IR_whIE&ab_channel=EVNautilus#science #SciComm #nautilus #ocean #NOAA

item.title: Grace Lindsay
item.description: The NYU Mind, Ethics, and Policy Program is hosting a panel on our recent report on AI consciousness on Sep 5 at 4pm ET on Zoom. https://sites.google.com/nyu.edu/mindethicspolicy/events

item.title: Dr. Sandra Duffy
item.description: I am WHEEZING.

item.title: Andr√© M Chagas
item.description:
Hi there!
Here is a short #introduction about me and things I have been doing lately!Living in the UK, after a decade in Germany, originally being from South America. for a while I have been an #openscience advocate and practitioner, focusing on #openhardware and tools for research. I currently work at the University of Sussex in the UK, as a scientific officer and a lecturer in Open Science. Some places that might be worth a visit (but some might be outdated)https://open-neuroscience.com (a community led repository for open source tools in Neuroscience - which I started back in 20143https://openhardware.space - online training resource for best practices on developing open hardwarehttps://amchagas.github.io (outdated personal page)https://prometheus-science.com (my side hustle, a company offering services around open source hardware and open science

item.title: Spencer LaVere Smith
item.description:
November 30, 2022:
A new AI tool was released. Less than 9 months later‚Ä¶August 23, 2023:
The name of the new AI tool was used in an insult during a televised debate among candidates running to be the US President.That‚Äôs an anecdote on how quickly the general population can become at least somewhat familiar with an AI tool, its name, and its strengths and weaknesses. I don‚Äôt know what portion of the audience knew what GPT stands for, but they got the joke. https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/ChatGPThttps://www.msn.com/en-us/news/politics/gop-debate-chris-christie-trashes-vivek-ramaswamy-as-an-amateur-who-sounds-like-chatgpt/ar-AA1fGVNq

item.title: Andy Bechtel
item.description: Front page of The Daily Tar Heel for Wednesday, Aug. 30. The page consists of excerpts from text messages sent by UNC students when a gunman shot and killed a physics professor, prompting a lockdown of several hours. #journalism #highered
